alert.note: Alert for Mendocino Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 7:52PM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following areas, Mendocino Coast, Northeastern Mendocino Interior, Northern Lake, Northwestern Mendocino Interior, Southeastern Mendocino Interior, Southern Lake and Southwestern Mendocino Interior. * WHEN...Through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Rock and mud slides are likely in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another system is expected to bring 1 to 2 inches of rain for the southern half of the area Tuesday. Saturated soils will increase the risk of flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
